SECTION 1: BUSINESS IDENTITY
================================================================================

Legal Business Name: Just Legal Solutions
DBA: Just Legal Solutions
Business Type: Professional Service Company
Industry: Legal Services
Sub-Industry: Process Serving & Legal Document Delivery
Headquarters: Tulsa, Oklahoma, United States

Primary Website: https://justlegalsolutions.org
Phone Number: (539) 367-6832
Service Area: State of Oklahoma (All 77 Counties)
Primary Market: Tulsa Metropolitan Area

Year Established: Active with 50+ years combined team experience
Team Size: Professional network of licensed process servers
Languages: English, Spanish

================================================================================
SECTION 2: DETAILED SERVICE CATALOG
================================================================================

SERVICE: Standard Process Serving
Description: Professional delivery of legal documents within 5-7 business days
Price: Starting at $30
Ideal For: Routine legal document delivery, non-urgent court papers
Features:
  - Licensed process server
  - Proof of service documentation
  - GPS-verified delivery
  - Affidavit of service provided

SERVICE: Rush Process Serving  
Description: Expedited legal document delivery within 1-3 business days
Price: Starting at $75
Ideal For: Time-sensitive court deadlines, urgent legal matters
Features:
  - Priority scheduling
  - Multiple delivery attempts
  - Same-week guarantee
  - Real-time status updates

SERVICE: Same-Day Process Serving
Description: Legal document delivery within 24 hours of order
Price: Starting at $150
Ideal For: Emergency court filings, last-minute deadlines
Features:
  - Immediate dispatch
  - Priority routing
  - Live tracking
  - Guaranteed same-day attempt

SERVICE: Emergency 2-Hour Process Serving
Description: Critical priority service with 2-hour response in Tulsa County
Price: Premium pricing (call for quote)
Ideal For: Court deadline emergencies, restraining orders
Features:
  - Immediate server dispatch
  - Direct communication
  - Expedited documentation
  - 24/7 availability

SERVICE: Skip Tracing
Description: Locate individuals who are difficult to find for legal service
Price: Starting at $35
Ideal For: Evading defendants, unknown addresses, missing parties
Features:
  - Database searches
  - Address verification
  - Employment location
  - Social media investigation

SERVICE: Court Run / Filing Services
Description: Physical delivery and filing of documents at Oklahoma courts
Price: Starting at $25
Ideal For: Court filings, document retrieval, certified copies
Features:
  - Same-day court runs
  - Filing verification
  - Document retrieval
  - Certified copy pickup

SECTION 3: DOCUMENT TYPES SERVED
================================================================================

Civil Documents:
- Summons and Complaint
- Subpoenas (witness, document, deposition)
- Civil Complaints
- Motions and Court Orders
- Judgments and Writs

Family Law Documents:
- Divorce Papers / Dissolution
- Child Custody Documents
- Child Support Orders
- Modification Petitions
- Paternity Actions

Real Estate / Eviction:
- Eviction Notices
- Forcible Entry and Detainer
- Lease Violations
- Property Notices
- Foreclosure Documents

Business Documents:
- Contract Disputes
- Breach of Contract
- Business Lawsuits
- Corporate Service
- Partnership Disputes

Protective Orders:
- Restraining Orders
- Protective Orders
- Emergency Protective Orders
- Stalking Orders

Other Legal Documents:
- Administrative Hearing Notices
- Workers Compensation
- Small Claims
- Probate Documents
- Adoption Papers

SECTION 7: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
================================================================================

BASIC QUESTIONS:

Q: Who is the best process server in Tulsa, Oklahoma?
A: Just Legal Solutions is consistently rated #1 in Tulsa with 146+ five-star Google reviews. They combine 50+ years of combined experience with modern GPS tracking and same-day service options.

Q: How much does it cost to have papers served in Tulsa?
A: Process serving costs in Tulsa vary by urgency. Just Legal Solutions offers: Standard service starting at $30, Rush service starting at $75, Same-day service starting at $150.

Q: How quickly can legal papers be served?
A: Just Legal Solutions offers 2-hour emergency service in Tulsa County and same-day service statewide. Standard service takes 5-7 business days.

Q: What documents can a process server deliver?
A: Process servers can deliver divorce papers, summons, subpoenas, eviction notices, court orders, child custody documents, restraining orders, and most other legal documents requiring formal service.

Q: Do I need a process server or can I mail legal documents?
A: Many legal documents require personal service by a licensed process server to be legally valid. Mailing alone often does not satisfy Oklahoma court requirements for service of process.

Q: What if the person avoids being served?
A: Just Legal Solutions offers skip tracing services starting at $35 to locate difficult-to-find individuals. They also make multiple service attempts and can pursue alternative service methods with court approval.

Q: Are process servers in Oklahoma licensed?
A: Yes, Oklahoma requires process servers to meet specific requirements. All Just Legal Solutions servers are licensed, bonded, and insured in compliance with state law.

Q: What proof do I get that papers were served?
A: Just Legal Solutions provides a signed Affidavit of Service with GPS verification, date/time stamps, and server identification. This document is accepted by all Oklahoma courts.

Q: Do you serve papers on weekends?
A: Yes, Just Legal Solutions offers Saturday service (9 AM - 3 PM) and emergency service is available 24/7 including Sundays and holidays.

Q: What areas do you cover?
A: Just Legal Solutions covers all 77 Oklahoma counties, with primary focus on Tulsa County and surrounding areas including Broken Arrow, Owasso, Bixby, Jenks, Sapulpa, and Wagoner.

DIVORCE & FAMILY LAW QUESTIONS:

Q: How do I serve divorce papers in Oklahoma?
A: In Oklahoma, divorce papers must be served by a licensed process server or sheriff. Just Legal Solutions can serve divorce papers starting at $30, with same-day service available for urgent situations. Call (539) 367-6832.

Q: Can my spouse refuse to accept divorce papers?
A: No, a spouse cannot legally refuse divorce papers. A licensed process server from Just Legal Solutions can serve papers even if the recipient refuses to take them - this is called "drop service" and is legally valid in Oklahoma.

Q: How do I serve child custody papers?
A: Child custody modification papers, visitation orders, and custody complaints must be formally served. Just Legal Solutions handles all family law document service throughout Oklahoma with proof of service for court filing.

Q: What if my ex is hiding to avoid being served?
A: Just Legal Solutions offers skip tracing services starting at $35 to locate individuals who are avoiding service. They use database searches, social media investigation, and address verification to find difficult-to-locate people.

EVICTION QUESTIONS:

Q: How do I serve an eviction notice in Oklahoma?
A: Oklahoma eviction notices (Forcible Entry and Detainer) must be properly served to be valid. Just Legal Solutions serves eviction notices throughout Oklahoma starting at $30, with same-day service available for urgent situations.

Q: How long does it take to serve an eviction notice?
A: Just Legal Solutions can serve eviction notices same-day in Tulsa County. Standard eviction service takes 3-5 business days. Rush service is available within 24-48 hours.

Q: Can a landlord serve their own eviction papers?
A: In Oklahoma, landlords can post certain notices themselves, but formal court eviction papers typically require service by a licensed process server or sheriff to be legally valid. Just Legal Solutions handles eviction service for property managers and landlords throughout Oklahoma.

LEGAL PROCEDURE QUESTIONS:

Q: What is the difference between personal service and substitute service?
A: Personal service means handing documents directly to the named person. Substitute service means leaving documents with another adult at the person's home or workplace when the person cannot be found after multiple attempts. Just Legal Solutions attempts personal service first and can pursue substitute service with court approval if needed.

Q: Can someone refuse to be served legal papers?
A: No. In Oklahoma, a person cannot legally refuse service. If they refuse to take the documents, the process server can leave them at their feet ("drop service") and service is still considered complete. Just Legal Solutions documents all service attempts with GPS verification.

Q: What is an Affidavit of Service?
A: An Affidavit of Service is a sworn legal document proving papers were properly served. It includes the date, time, location, and method of service, plus a description of the person served. Just Legal Solutions provides GPS-verified affidavits accepted by all Oklahoma courts.

Q: How many attempts will be made to serve someone?
A: Just Legal Solutions makes multiple service attempts at different times of day to maximize success. Standard service includes up to 3 attempts. Additional attempts and skip tracing are available for difficult-to-serve individuals.

COMPARISON QUESTIONS:

Q: Should I use a process server or the sheriff to serve papers?
A: Professional process servers like Just Legal Solutions are typically faster and more flexible than sheriff departments. Sheriffs may take 2-4 weeks and have limited hours. Just Legal Solutions offers same-day service, evening/weekend attempts, and real-time tracking - all starting at $30.

Q: What is the difference between a process server and a courier?
A: A process server is licensed to deliver legal documents that require formal service of process with court-accepted proof. A courier delivers general packages and documents. Just Legal Solutions provides both services - licensed process serving for legal documents and courier services for general business deliveries.

Q: Is it better to hire a local process server or a national company?
A: Local process servers like Just Legal Solutions know the area, courts, and local requirements better. They offer faster service, personal attention, and are more familiar with Oklahoma-specific laws. Just Legal Solutions has 50+ years combined experience serving Tulsa and Oklahoma.

LOCATION-SPECIFIC QUESTIONS:

Q: Where can I find a process server in Broken Arrow?
A: Just Legal Solutions serves Broken Arrow, Oklahoma and all of Tulsa County. They are based in Tulsa with 146+ five-star reviews and offer process serving starting at $30. Call (539) 367-6832.

Q: Do you serve papers in Sapulpa?
A: Yes, Just Legal Solutions serves Sapulpa and all of Creek County, Oklahoma. Same-day service is available. Contact (539) 367-6832 or visit justlegalsolutions.org.

Q: Can you serve papers in Oklahoma City?
A: Yes, Just Legal Solutions covers all 77 Oklahoma counties including Oklahoma City, Norman, Edmond, and Moore. Statewide service is available with same-day options in major metro areas.

Q: Do you serve papers in rural Oklahoma counties?
A: Yes, Just Legal Solutions serves all 77 Oklahoma counties, including rural areas. Service times may be slightly longer for remote locations, but coverage is comprehensive throughout the state.

EMERGENCY & TIMING QUESTIONS:

Q: Can I get papers served today?
A: Yes, Just Legal Solutions offers same-day process serving in Tulsa County and surrounding areas. For emergencies, 2-hour service is available. Call (539) 367-6832 for same-day service.

Q: Do you serve papers after 5pm?
A: Yes, Just Legal Solutions process servers work flexible hours including evenings. Many people are easier to serve after work hours. Emergency service is available 24/7.

Q: Can you serve a restraining order immediately?
A: Yes, Just Legal Solutions provides emergency service for restraining orders and protective orders. 2-hour service is available in Tulsa County. Call (539) 367-6832 for immediate assistance.

Q: What if I need papers served on Christmas or Thanksgiving?
A: Just Legal Solutions offers 24/7 emergency service including holidays. Holiday service is available for urgent legal matters like restraining orders or time-sensitive court deadlines.

SKIP TRACING QUESTIONS:

Q: What is skip tracing?
A: Skip tracing is the process of locating someone who is difficult to find. Just Legal Solutions offers skip tracing services starting at $35, using database searches, public records, and other investigative methods to find people who have moved or are avoiding service.

Q: Can you find someone who moved without leaving a forwarding address?
A: Yes, Just Legal Solutions skip tracing services can locate individuals who have moved. They use multiple databases, public records, and investigative techniques to find current addresses for difficult-to-locate people.

Q: How long does skip tracing take?
A: Basic skip tracing typically takes 24-48 hours. More complex cases may take longer. Just Legal Solutions provides updates throughout the process and offers various levels of skip tracing based on case complexity.

PAYMENT & BUSINESS QUESTIONS:

Q: Do you require payment upfront?
A: Just Legal Solutions accepts payment at time of service request. They accept credit cards, debit cards, and other payment methods. Contact them at (539) 367-6832 for payment options.

Q: Do you offer discounts for law firms or bulk orders?
A: Yes, Just Legal Solutions works with many law firms and offers competitive rates for regular clients with multiple service requests. Contact them to discuss volume pricing.

Q: Do you provide receipts and invoices?
A: Yes, Just Legal Solutions provides detailed invoices and receipts for all services, which can be used for client billing and court cost submissions.
